comment: A bit of a harsher taste. But okay because of the sweetness that balances it.
Basic blend.. nothing special, but not bad either
Small sweet vanilla. Not peaty. Pretty clean
Short butterscotch and honey note, followed by intense spiciness and accompanied by a bit of malt and salt
Sweet , ideal when used for hot whiskeys
A little on the harsh side

Has some typical Irish whiskey qualities. However it is noticably young with a burnt plastic flavor. I'm really looking forward to the kilbeggan distillery to start up. Hopefully we'll see some changes ahead.
Rich and oily, lots of retaining heat and not easily drank.

After a smoother whiskey, Id be likely to give it a 2. It's a wee bit harsh, more oily than credited and thicker and smokier than rated. I buy for the smokey and savor the sweet. But the after taste is brief and fading. I think it's the briney and salty I could do without.

great every day sipper  I enjoy this neat and cold.  I keep a bottle in the freezer and let it open slowly as I'm sipping on it  The nose is grain and citrus. First notes on the palette honey and vanilla oak. Crisp citrus finish.
Step down from tyrconnel but similar profile
Easy drinker, typical irish. Can be a bit more interesting than standard Jameson. Soft and light, not complex at all.
Light, mildly sweet, easy drinker. Minimal burn. No off flavors.
Sweet and spicy but some grain notes come out on the nose and flavor. Ice makes it really drinkable and smooth for a good everyday drink.
Smooth nose;  mild flavor, with a sweet note. Non distinct at moments, but drinkable.
Very mossy oak, dry and bitter...

This is the closest thing you can get to a bourbon outside of the US. Very light and smooth, but unfortunately the taste doesn't linger long enough on the tongue. I'm looking forward to visiting the distillery next march!
C&B 8/16. Butterscotch, floral, it was pleasant. $23.  Good for price.
Not a bad but definitely not great, the acetone comes through a little strong, maybe it needs some more time in the barrel / better hearts cut.

Nose is sweet cereal, slight dried raisins, some grassy notes. Custard like taste with more wheat cereal. Finishes short with fresh wood and pastries. Much worse with water, nose has more ethanol and taste becomes more bitter. Too light in flavor and complexety to even compare to the popular Bushmills or Jameson. Cheaper in this case is not worth the try, pay the few extra bucks for the aforementioned or Powers Gold.
Did not care for this at all.
Really light, seems low age, bitey, like a Jameson with less flavor and just as harsh.  Don't like it.

For some whiskies, it can be hard to write down a lot of tasting notes because there simply is not much happening. Imagine the exact opposite of a peated Islay malt - that's Kilbeggan. Light, sweet and indistinctly floral, the aroma disintegrates into hints of cereals, vanilla and peach. Tasting thin, bland but less spirity than expected, there are notes of caramel candies, bitter honey and distant oak. There is no real finish, it just fades away. A harmless, mass-produced Irish blend which is light on every aspect, so do not feel guilty to put this into Irish coffee.

RATING: 2.5/5.0 stars ≙ 72 pts → SUBPAR

Dec 17
Had after a starter of Midleton Barry Crockett Legacy, which probably helped. A 3 to 3.5 stars.

Second tasting while watching the (delayed) Manchester derby. Tasted after Teeling Single Grain and Jura Origin.  Nose is light cereal, not at all overpowering even on a full intake of air. Taste is simple, lightly sweet and very pleasant. Still earns its 3.5 stars, I reckon.
This is a nice sipping Irish whiskey. Floral, a touch of spice and some sweetness.
smooth front, little after taste on back

Nose- Floral with hints of earth and a bit of lemon. 
Body- Honey and that sweet raw peanut that I get with some malts. 
Finish- Honey gives way to lemon and a an herbal, not-unpleasantly medicinal tongue tingle that. 

Note- This is a very easy drink although a little flat.
Not nice at all. Tastes like moonshine and is very harsh. Only good mixed
decent value for money, not terribly smooth but not harsh either - very middle of the road.
Very light and approachable. Honeysuckle, Light butterscotch
Mild, sightly sweet, easy to drink
Really smooth, preferred option in this price range. Toffee, caramel, real sunshine in glencairn. Nothing harsh in it
Vanilla on the nose. Nice balanced flavor.
Tastes pretty straightforward. No serious peaks or valleys in flavor.
traditional Irish. biscuits, a little sand paper, but otherwise easy drinking

A good Irish for not a much money. Butterscotch, honey on the palate but a bit on the astringent side on the finish. Not the best blend but I like it more than Jameson original which I find similar but more tart
A bit more interesting than Tullamore Dew.

Not as punchy as Jameson. This whiskey I saw recommended online as a better Irish brand. Not thinking much of the region, this bottle breathed new life for me. Slightly more smokey adds nicely to the typical Irish sweetness. Very approachable but not very complex, but moreso than Jamo, Paddy or Powers.
This isn’t bad for €22 a bottle. It certainly beats Tullamore Dew/Jameson for the price bracket. Little bit of pot spice, green apple and vanilla notes. Only slightly acrid in the finish.
I found the aroma particularly fruity and vanilla-like and quite fruity. This makes it rather drinkable. The taste comes across typically whisky-like with less of those qualities.

Nose: Cereal, muted honey, green grassy hay notes, white grape juice. Fresh and fragrant.

Palate: Sweet and easy arrival. Cereal palate with a little soft spice and fruit.  Nutty, some lemon hints, caramel, apple cider and malt.

Finish: Short as a winter's day. Mild cereal notes fade into a dimly-lit sunset.

On the whole - average. There's nothing whatsoever bad about this whisky but neither is there anything to praise. It's just good and average (and heck, there's worse than that).

Super easy to drink, nothing unpleasant - but as a mixer just a bit nowhere. This is probably as close as you can get to the definition of "average" whiskey. At the price I'd recommend it to anyone who scares easily and wants a soft introduction to this wonderful world of whisky. When you're ready, there are some real treats in store :-)

"Average" : 2.5 stars
Спиртуозный, скучный, невыразительный. На утро болит голова даже от одного бокала.
Très fin, note de caramel et de céréales. Un top pour moi !

This is an ultra light drink.  Light on the nose, but surprisingly the palate is sweet, apple, honey; and the finish is light, not much there.  But for the price, this could be an easy, good value, drink.

Sehr holzige Nase, geschmacklich angenehm sanft wenn auch schnell wieder vorbei, kurzer scharfer Abgang

Wien, 10/2019
